content: impossible girl socks pattern by madeline gannon impossible girl socks i m clara oswald i m the impossible girl i was born to save the doctor bbc s doctor who these socks are inspired by clara oswald companion in the infamous bbc series doctor who known as the impossible girl clara is largely a mystery to audiences as well as the doctor himself but throughout her adventures with the doctor she never finds herself less than impeccably dressed these classy whimsical socks remind me of socks clara may wear to keep warm while traveling through planets of ice and snow or just lounging by the fireplace in victorian london materials & notes abbreviations yarn one 1 skein of standard sock/ k = knit fingering weight yarn approx 350- p = purl 400 yards k2tog = knit two together needles us size 1 or 1 5 needles 2 25mm or yo = yarn over 2 5mm or preferred size ssk = slip slip knit2tog tbl gauge 10 sts x 15 row per 1 pm = place marker notions stitch markers & darning needle rm = remove marker size medium large bor = beginning of round co = cast on cl3 = cluster 3 lift the 3rd stitch on the left needle over the first 2 stitches and off the needle co 64 72 stiches loosely using preferred cast on divide over dpns or circular needles and join for knitting in the round cuff work 20 row of *k2 p2* ribbing approx 1 5 or to desired length leg follow written directions for mock-cable pattern row 1-3 front k3 4 p1 k3 p1 k16 18 p1 k3 p1 k3 4 back k32 36 row 4 front k3 4 p1 cl3 k1 yo k1 p1 k16 18 p1 cl3 k1 yo k1 p1 k3 4 back k32 36 repeat row 1-4 fourteen times or to desired length then being heel heel insert preferred heel technique here or follow the heel flap instructions below heel flap to create the heel flap you will be knitting 1/2 of your stitches flat across one needle 32 36 stitches row 1 *s1 k1 * repeat across row 2 s1 purl across repeat these two row 16 18 times then proceed to heel turn heel turn row 1 s1 k18 20 ssk k1 turn row 2 s1 p7 p2tog p1 turn row 3 s1 knit to 1st before gap ssk k1 turn row 4 s1 purl to 1st before gap p2tog p1 turn repeat row 3 & 4 until all stitches have been worked 22sts on heel knit back across your heel needle and begin picking up sets in side 1 of your gusset picking up one stitch for each visible slipped end stitch note pick up an extra stitch in the ladder between the stitches on the row below to avoid a gap place marker knit across instep stitches place marker and move to gusset side 2 pick extra stitch in the ladder between the stitches on
